TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit RemotingTimeoutException extends System.Runtime.Remoting.RemotingException

Docs.summary: The exception that is thrown when the server or the client cannot be reached for a previously specified period of time.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.RemotingTimeoutException> is thrown when a remoting call does not complete in the specified timeout time.
<xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.RemotingTimeoutException> uses the HRESULT COR_E_REMOTING, which has the value 0x8013150B.
<xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.RemotingTimeoutException> uses the default <xref:System.Object.Equals%2A> implementation, which supports reference equality.
For a list of initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.RemotingTimeoutException>, see the <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.RemotingTimeoutException> constructors.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with default properties.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.RemotingTimeoutException> inherits from the <xref:System.Exception> class. The following table shows initial property values for an instance of the <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.RemotingTimeoutException> class:
|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A>|`null`| |<xref:System.Exception.Message%2A>|Localized error message for <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.RemotingTimeoutException>|

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string message) cil managed

Docs.param: The message that indicates the reason why the exception occurred.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of class with a specified message.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.RemotingTimeoutException> inherits from the <xref:System.Exception> class. The following table shows initial property values for an instance of the <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.RemotingTimeoutException> class:
|Property Type|Condition| |-------------------|---------------| |<xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A>|`null`| |<xref:System.Exception.Message%2A>|The `message` string|

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string message, class System.Exception InnerException) cil managed

Docs.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception. If the InnerException parameter is not , the current exception is raised in a block that handles the inner exception.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.

remarks.format:
## Remarks An exception that is thrown as a direct result of a previous exception must include a reference to the previous exception in the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property. The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property returns the same value that is passed into the constructor, or `null` if the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property does not supply the inner exception value to the constructor.
The following table shows initial property values for an instance of the <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.RemotingTimeoutException> class:
|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A>|The inner exception reference| |<xref:System.Exception.Message%2A>|The error message string|
